articles.author: Jon Henley, Angela Giuffrida
articles.title: French daily Covid cases above 200,000 as Italy considers stricter green pass - The Guardian
articles.description: France sets European record, and France and Italy may drop negative tests as pass to enter bars or workplaces
articles.content:
France has registered a national and European record for new coronavirus infections as the Omicron variant fuels a surge in cases across the continent, with multiple countries hitting new highs.
Fra… [+5552 chars]

articles.author: Renju Jose and Crispian Balmer
articles.title: ‘Tsunami’ of COVID-19 cases around world raises testing and quarantine fears - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: France’s Health Minister said the country was seeing a “dizzying” rise in cases, with 208,000 reported in the space of 24 hours – a national and European record.
articles.content:
Global COVID-19 infections hit a record high over the past seven-day period as the Omicron variant raced out of control, keeping workers at home and overwhelming testing centres.
Almost 900,000 case… [+1681 chars]

articles.title: France hit by 'dizzying' daily record of over 200000 new COVID-19 cases - Reuters
articles.description: France is seeing a "tsunami" of COVID-19 infections, with 208,000 cases reported over the past 24 hours, a new national and European record, Health Minister Olivier Veran told lawmakers on Wednesday.
articles.content: PARIS, Dec 29 (Reuters) - France is seeing a "tsunami" of COVID-19 infections, with 208,000 cases reported over the past 24 hours, a new national and European record, Health Minister Olivier Veran to… [+1816 chars]

articles.title: Covid-19 Pandemic Gives New Hope to One of the World’s Fastest-Shrinking Countries - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Coronavirus pushed many to return to Eastern European countries like Bulgaria that had seen sharp population declines
articles.content:
SOFIA, BulgariaWhen Nicko Aleksiev left this city for France, in 2011, he didnt expect he would ever live in Bulgaria again.
